column5: It was very busy Jay.Id say pre covid shows.Not much of a chance for a break.Steady people streaming by and stopping to talk.

I’ve been to all 3 and Milwaukee seems the smallest. The location was really good near a big mall & restaurants and the convention center was new & clean. I think there were around 65 camps there and I was there at the opening and there was a line of I bet 80 people waiting for the doors to open. I’m 52 and the majority of people I saw were in my age or older but I was there early. Hats off to Milwaukee for their show as I have not been to Kane County fairgrounds for a long time but it was a dump back then so I’ll see what it’s like next Thursday.

Thanks for the response and I like what I hear! Sure would like to see these camps be back up to pre-covid groups. I'm sure many are like us and don't take much out of the resource so that it can continue to thrive. Later, Jay
Were there many camps that went out of business due to Covid or isn't anybody talking about that.
Probably cheaper than a Fly-in no doubt ! And there's no Limit............lol.

The camp I was at this past fall has been for sale for awhile, the camp owner has been selling sections of it and he's still trying sell more of it. Here's a few more: https://ontarioresortsforsale.net/

Our waters are thriving pretty good.With almost 2 complete summers of very little fish coming out of our waters there were a lot of huge schools of walleyes.Dont think the extra 2 years of covid fish was touched plus 2 spawns.Our size limits and possession limits seem to be doing very good.Also find some fisherman don't even want to take fish home.So another plus.There was only one camp that sold to covid.Young couple that didn't have years in like most camps.From what I hear most camps are already pretty much booked up for this coming season.So looking like another good season
If you buy enough fillets it's the same price as a flyin!they ain't near as fresh as,From the hook to the knife to the oil,don't get any better than that.
Rather shop for fish from a boat on a secluded lake rather than walking through a boring store.
The trips are priceless in MY opinion!! Later, Jay
Costco has good walleye that seems pretty fresh

John, If I still lived in Chicago I would definitely drive up to the Milwaukee Show to meet you and your wife. Went every year to the All Canada Show in St Charles. Booked my first fly-in at the Show in 1980 My Dad started me going to sport shows by taking me in the 1950's to the Sport Show at Navy Pier in Chicago. Use to pick up all the brochures and Dad would let me fish for trout in trout pond Larry Schroeder, Henderson Nevada
Sam's Club also has frozen Walleye fillets. Pretty tasty!
Let's make a plan to meet at Clarks on your fly out day unless iam out guiding then maybe when you return from the outpost.Will figure something out.Be nice to meet up with you.
I think we are coming out in august the same day Larry goes in,might see ya then if your not out making a fortune.
Anything is possible.where you headed into.
Otatakan,cpl's trip,Chatie going to show me how to catch fish!
That's going to be totally possible.haha.

Hooks[/QUOTE]Thx for stopping in to say hi.Hope you find something at show.plenty of options.Just got home yesterday.Stayed in Virginia.Roads were great all the home which is a bonus.Now I need a fishing fix which might happen tomorrow.[/QUOTE]Did you decide on your trip for this summer.
Prov1800, Can you estimate attendance at the show? Is it getting back to pre covid or still at a standstill? Later, Jay

as well have great memories of going to the show with dad and gramps as a kid. loved all the brochures. loved looking at the dream spots like Bud's gunisao fishing for 5 grand for 2 days. haha. would break out the brochures in the winter and look at the spots and where they were located. How much? how big was the lake? only spot on the lake? just things they would look for.
It’s a small bag but you’re right, it can go to the burn barrel this Spring Cleaning

Rich, we hope to catch you there, we will be browsing around Friday night and Saturday. John, also hope to catch you at the Latrelle booth. As usual we will touch base with Moss at Woman River and anyone else we might have run across in our many adventures in Canada. We are hoping to book an August trip with somebody this weekend. Also I didn't expect a spat on this thread from the kids that must have grabbed their dads I pad. Remember to keep them from your electronics! Hooks
Hooks it doesn't take much to get a spat going on here.See what these sports shows can do to people!
Right you are! And I didn't even mention the C word!

Is anyone going to the show in Green Bay? My wife and I are coming, but as soon as we enter the door, she goes over to the machines and I head for the show. I see my beer fund taking a real hit that weekend.
Sounds good.wife and I just pulled into the conference center and getting settled in.Putting up booths tomorrow.Catch you later

Thx for stopping in to say hi.Hope you find something at show.plenty of options.Just got home yesterday.Stayed in Virginia.Roads were great all the home which is a bonus.Now I need a fishing fix which might happen tomorrow.
You don't have to drive far for that fix,just got to figure out what drug you want to yank off the bottom.
Couple of walleye will do.Havnt had any for a week.They had walleye at the show but didn't look good to me.Like mine fresh.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSX9bqsifR0
You watching the game up at the Moose tonight over a cup of coffee...........LOL.
Another one word description...troll
Two word description - shrimp dick
Most likely popped a hernia coming up with that. Seek medical attention.

Fond memories of going to the All Canada Show with my Dad who has since passed. That was when they used to come to Des Moines!!!!!Always made an evening of it and would collect bags full of brochures and rate sheets to review and assess for that next trip North! Always finished at a local Pizza joint for a combo pizza, pile of thick cut onion rings and a couple of beers served in those heavy frosted mugs!!!!Man do I miss those little one night adventures with my Pops!!!!
Sounds like a great time for sure

Our group used to do the same thing: collect brochures and then go out for pizza or burgers to decide where were going that year. I kept the brochures after we choose were to go as I just LOVED looking at all the lodges in Canada on a cold winter's evening.
I still have 2 bags in my fishing closet- 1 bag of interested camps and the other bag of not interested. Usually on a cold winter night I’ll look through them just to stoke the fire until late May.
Use the not so interested ones to get that fire going Rich.
Could be a she...or a they.
Might make Milwaukee pending on work but will definitely be at St. Charles early February wearing my Muck Boots.
If you make it come over and say hi
Definitely will and I hope I can swing by Friday night if things work out for work as it wouldBe great to meet you and pick your brain on pike fishing.
Awesome.hope to see you
We always hire a driver for our trips. GPF likes to be chauffeured around. Been a long time since i was called an imbicile but will take it as a compliment from the lamb killer.
if you make milwaukee, give zafirros pizza a try. one of the best if you like thin crust. also a good corned beef town
It wasn't a compliment bigdumb. L m b stands for largemouth bass. This is a fishing forum isn't it
Will give it a try.Thin crust the best.thx.
Now you hurt my feelings Little Man Balls
Dock and I heading to the Milwaukee All Canada Show next weekend. Anyone we should look for? Hooks
Come and visit my wife and I in the Latreile Lake Lodge booth.
Take some of your cheap eggs along with you.
Will you be at the Chicago show?
@prov1800/Chicago Show?
No not this year.
I will be at Chicago show with GPF. We arrive Friday on greyhound if you guys want to drink some captain. We are staying at the super 8
The Super 8 isn't anywhere near the show venue. Why are you staying there, if you don't have a car? HRG
The captain will guide him there.
Honestly are u surprised hrg? He's an imbecile on this site anyways
